info.title: simcore-service-director-v2
info.description: Orchestrates the pipeline of services defined by the user

servers.description: Default server: requests directed to serving url
Development server: can configure any base url

post.summary: Create Or Update Or Start Computation
post.description: Create and optionally start a new computation

404.description: Project or pricing details not found

get.summary: Gets computation task logs file after is done
get.description:
Returns download links to log-files of each task in a computation.
Each log is only available when the corresponding task is done

schema.title: Response Get All Tasks Log Files V2 Computations  Project Id  Tasks   Logfile Get

get.summary: Gets computation task logs file after is done
get.description:
Returns a link to download logs file of a give task.
The log is only available when the task is done

post.summary: Gets all outputs for selected tasks

404.description: Cannot find computation or the tasks in it

get.summary: returns a list of running interactive services filtered by user_id and/or project_idboth legacy (director-v0) and modern (director-v2)

schema.title: Response List Tracked Dynamic Services V2 Dynamic Services Get

get.summary: assembles the status for the dynamic-sidecar

post.summary: Calls the dynamic service's retrieve endpoint with optional port_keys
Calls the dynamic service's restart containers endpoint

patch.summary: Updates the project networks according to the current project's workbench

get.summary: returns if the project is inactive

schema.title: Response Delete Service Containers V2 Dynamic Scheduler Services  Node Uuid  Containers Delete

409.description: Task already running, cannot start a new one

409.description: Task already running, cannot start a new one

409.description: Task already running, cannot start a new one

delete.summary: Removes the service's sidecar, proxy and docker networks & volumes

schema.title: Response Delete Service Docker Resources V2 Dynamic Scheduler Services  Node Uuid  Docker Resources Delete

409.description: Task already running, cannot start a new one

released.title: Released
released.description: Maps every route's path tag with a released version

metrics.description: command to recover prometheus metrics from a specific user service

before_shutdown.title: Before Shutdown
before_shutdown.description: commands to run before shutting down the user servicescommands get executed first to last, multiple commands for the sameuser services are allowed

inactivity.description: command used to figure out for how much time the user service(s) were inactive for

start_pipeline.title: Start Pipeline
start_pipeline.description: if True the computation pipeline will start right away

subgraph.title: Subgraph
subgraph.description: An optional set of nodes that must be executed, if empty the whole pipeline is executed

force_restart.title: Force Restart
force_restart.description: if True will force re-running all dependent nodes

use_on_demand_clusters.title: Use On Demand Clusters
use_on_demand_clusters.description: if True, a cluster will be created as necessary (wallet_id cannot be None)

wallet_info.description: contains information about the wallet used to bill the running service

force.title: Force
force.description: if True then the pipeline will be removed even if it is running

id.title: Id
id.description: the id of the computation task

state.description: the state of the computational task

result.title: Result
result.description: the result of the computational task

pipeline_details.description: the details of the generated pipeline

iteration.title: Iteration
iteration.description: the iteration id of the computation task (none if no task ran yet)

started.title: Started
started.description: the timestamp when the computation was started or None if not started yet

stopped.title: Stopped
stopped.description: the timestamp when the computation was stopped or None if not started nor stopped yet

submitted.title: Submitted
submitted.description: task last modification timestamp or None if the there is no task

url.title: Url
url.description: the link where to get the status of the task

stop_url.title: Stop Url
stop_url.description: the link where to stop the task

Status.description:
String representation of the container state. Can be one of "created",
"running", "paused", "restarting", "removing", "exited", or "dead".

Running.title: Running
Running.description:
Whether this container is running.

Note that a running container can be _paused_. The `Running` and `Paused`
booleans are not mutually exclusive:

When pausing a container (on Linux), the freezer cgroup is used to suspend
all processes in the container. Freezing the process requires the process to
be running. As a result, paused containers are both `Running` _and_ `Paused`.

Use the `Status` field instead to determine if a container's state is "running".

OOMKilled.title: Oomkilled
OOMKilled.description: Whether this container has been killed because it ran out of memory.

Pid.title: Pid
Pid.description: The process ID of this container

ExitCode.title: Exitcode
ExitCode.description: The last exit code of this container

StartedAt.title: Startedat
StartedAt.description: The time when this container was last started.

FinishedAt.title: Finishedat
FinishedAt.description: The time when this container last exited.

ContainerState.title: ContainerState
ContainerState.description:
ContainerState stores container's running state. It's part of ContainerJSONBase
and will be returned by the "inspect" command.

address.title: Address
address.description: this is not an url address is derived from IP address

delay_for.title: Delay For
delay_for.description: interval of time during which exceptions are ignored

DelayedExceptionHandler.title: DelayedExceptionHandler
DelayedExceptionHandler.description:
Allows to ignore an exception for an established
period of time after which it is raised.

This use case most commonly occurs when dealing with
external systems.
For example, due to poor network  performance or
network congestion, an external system which is healthy,
currently is not reachable any longer.
A possible solution:
- ignore exceptions for an interval in which the
    system usually is reachable again by not
    raising the error
- if the error persist give up and raise it

Example code usage:

    delayed_handler_external_service = DelayedExceptionHandler(
        delay_for=60
    )
    try:
        function_called_periodically_accessing_external_service()
    except TargetException as e:
        delayed_handler_external_service.try_to_raise(e)
    else:
        delayed_handler_external_service.else_reset()

service_key.title: Service Key
service_key.description: distinctive name for the node based on the docker registry path

service_version.title: Service Version
service_version.description: semantic version number of the node

service_basepath.title: Service Basepath
service_basepath.description: predefined path where the dynamic service should be served. If empty, the service shall use the root endpoint.

can_save.title: Can Save
can_save.description: the service data must be saved when closing

wallet_info.description: contains information about the wallet used to bill the running service

pricing_info.description: contains pricing information (ex. pricing plan and unit ids)

status.description: status of the service sidecar also with additional information

is_ready.title: Is Ready
is_ready.description: is True while the health check on the dynamic-sidecar is responding. Meaning that the dynamic-sidecar is reachable and can accept requests

was_compose_spec_submitted.title: Was Compose Spec Submitted
was_compose_spec_submitted.description: if the docker-compose spec was already submitted this fields is True

containers_inspect.title: Containers Inspect
containers_inspect.description: docker inspect results from all the container ran at regular intervals

were_containers_created.title: Were Containers Created
were_containers_created.description: when True no longer will the Docker api be used to check if the services were started

is_project_network_attached.title: Is Project Network Attached
is_project_network_attached.description: When True, all containers were in running state and project networks were attached. Waiting for the container sto be in running state guarantees all containers have been created

is_service_environment_ready.title: Is Service Environment Ready
is_service_environment_ready.description: True when the environment setup required by the dynamic-sidecars created services was completed.Example: nodeports data downloaded, globally shared service data fetched, etc..

service_removal_state.description: stores information used during service removal from the dynamic-sidecar scheduler

wait_for_manual_intervention_after_error.title: Wait For Manual Intervention After Error
wait_for_manual_intervention_after_error.description: Marks the sidecar as untouchable since there was an error and important data might be lost. awaits for manual intervention.

wait_for_manual_intervention_logged.title: Wait For Manual Intervention Logged
wait_for_manual_intervention_logged.description: True if a relative message was logged

were_state_and_outputs_saved.title: Were State And Outputs Saved
were_state_and_outputs_saved.description: set True if the dy-sidecar saves the state and uploads the outputs

instrumentation.description: keeps track times for various operations

dynamic_sidecar_id.title: Dynamic Sidecar Id
dynamic_sidecar_id.description: returned by the docker engine; used for starting the proxy

dynamic_sidecar_network_id.title: Dynamic Sidecar Network Id
dynamic_sidecar_network_id.description: returned by the docker engine; used for starting the proxy

swarm_network_id.title: Swarm Network Id
swarm_network_id.description: returned by the docker engine; used for starting the proxy

docker_node_id.title: Docker Node Id
docker_node_id.description: contains node id of the docker node where all services and created containers are started

inspect_error_handler.description: Set when the dy-sidecar can no longer be reached by the director-v2. If it will be possible to reach the dy-sidecar again, this value will be set to None.

Status.description:
Status is one of `none`, `starting`, `healthy` or `unhealthy`

- "none"      Indicates there is no healthcheck
- "starting"  Starting indicates that the container is not yet ready
- "healthy"   Healthy indicates that the container is running correctly
- "unhealthy" Unhealthy indicates that the container has a problem

FailingStreak.title: Failingstreak
FailingStreak.description: FailingStreak is the number of consecutive failures

Log.title: Log
Log.description: Log contains the last few results (oldest first)

Health.title: Health
Health.description: Health stores information about the container's healthcheck results.

Start.title: Start
Start.description:
Date and time at which this check started in
[RFC 3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt) format with nano-seconds.

End.title: End
End.description:
Date and time at which this check ended in
[RFC 3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt) format with nano-seconds.

ExitCode.title: Exitcode
ExitCode.description:
ExitCode meanings:

- `0` healthy
- `1` unhealthy
- `2` reserved (considered unhealthy)
- other values: error running probe

HealthcheckResult.title: HealthcheckResult
HealthcheckResult.description: HealthcheckResult stores information about a single run of a healthcheck probe

image.title: Image
image.description: Used by the frontend to provide a context for the users.Services with a docker-compose spec will have multiple entries.Using the `image:version` instead of the docker-compose spec is more helpful for the end user.

boot_modes.title: Boot Modes
boot_modes.description: describe how a service shall be booted, using CPU, MPI, openMP or GPU

dns_resolver.description: specify a DNS resolver address and port

modified.title: Modified
modified.description: true if the node's outputs need to be re-computed

dependencies.title: Dependencies
dependencies.description: contains the node inputs dependencies if they need to be computed first

progress.title: Progress
progress.description: current progress of the task if available (None if not started or not a computational task)

inputs_path.title: Inputs Path
inputs_path.description: folder path where the service expects all the inputs

outputs_path.title: Outputs Path
outputs_path.description: folder path where the service is expected to provide all its outputs

state_paths.title: State Paths
state_paths.description: optional list of paths which contents need to be persisted

state_exclude.title: State Exclude
state_exclude.description: optional list unix shell rules used to exclude files from the state

volume_size_limits.title: Volume Size Limits
volume_size_limits.description: Apply volume size limits to entries in: `inputs_path`, `outputs_path` and `state_paths`. Limits must be parsable by Pydantic's ByteSize.

legacy_state.description: if present, the service needs to first try to download the legacy statecoming from a different path.

adjacency_list.title: Adjacency List
adjacency_list.description: The adjacency list of the current pipeline in terms of {NodeID: [successor NodeID]}

progress.title: Progress
progress.description: the progress of the pipeline (None if there are no computational tasks)

node_states.title: Node States
node_states.description: The states of each of the computational nodes in the pipeline

port_keys.title: Port Keys
port_keys.description: The port keys to retrieve data from

size_bytes.title: Size Bytes
size_bytes.description: The amount of data transferred by the retrieve call

service_key.title: Service Key
service_key.description: distinctive name for the node based on the docker registry path

service_version.title: Service Version
service_version.description: semantic version number of the node

service_basepath.title: Service Basepath
service_basepath.description: predefined path where the dynamic service should be served. If empty, the service shall use the root endpoint.

boot_type.description: Describes how the dynamic services was started (legacy=V0, modern=V2).Since legacy services do not have this label it defaults to V0.

service_host.title: Service Host
service_host.description: the service swarm internal host name

published_port.title: Published Port
published_port.description: the service swarm published port if any

entry_point.title: Entry Point
entry_point.description: if empty the service entrypoint is on the root endpoint.

service_message.title: Service Message
service_message.description: additional information related to service state

RunningState.title: RunningState
RunningState.description:
State of execution of a project's computational workflow

SEE StateType for task state

simcore.service.compose-spec.title: Simcore.Service.Compose-Spec
simcore.service.compose-spec.description: json encoded docker-compose specifications. see https://docs.docker.com/compose/compose-file/, only used by dynamic-sidecar.

simcore.service.container-http-entrypoin.title: Simcore.Service.Container-Http-Entrypoint
simcore.service.container-http-entrypoin.description: When a docker-compose specifications is provided, the container where the traffic must flow has to be specified. Required by dynamic-sidecar when compose_spec is set.

simcore.service.restart-policy.description:
the dynamic-sidecar can restart all running containers on certain events. Supported events:
- `no-restart` default
- `on-inputs-downloaded` after inputs are downloaded

simcore.service.containers-allowed-outgo.title: Simcore.Service.Containers-Allowed-Outgoing-Permit-List
simcore.service.containers-allowed-outgo.description: allow internet access to certain domain names and ports per container

simcore.service.containers-allowed-outgo.title: Simcore.Service.Containers-Allowed-Outgoing-Internet
simcore.service.containers-allowed-outgo.description: allow complete internet access to containers in here

service_key.title: Service Key
service_key.description: distinctive name for the node based on the docker registry path

service_version.title: Service Version
service_version.description: semantic version number of the node

service_name.title: Service Name
service_name.description: Name of the current dynamic-sidecar being observed

run_id.title: Run Id
run_id.description: Uniquely identify the dynamic sidecar session (a.k.a. 2 subsequent exact same services will have a different run_id)

dynamic_sidecar.description: stores information fetched from the dynamic-sidecar

dynamic_sidecar_network_name.title: Dynamic Sidecar Network Name
dynamic_sidecar_network_name.description: overlay network biding the proxy to the container spaned by the dynamic-sidecar

simcore_traefik_zone.title: Simcore Traefik Zone
simcore_traefik_zone.description: required for Traefik to correctly route requests to the spawned container

service_port.title: Service Port
service_port.description: port where the service is exposed defined by the service; NOTE: temporary default because it will be changed once the service is started, this value is fetched from the service start spec

service_resources.title: Service Resources
service_resources.description: service resources used to enforce limits

request_dns.title: Request Dns
request_dns.description: used when configuring the CORS options on the proxy

request_scheme.title: Request Scheme
request_scheme.description: used when configuring the CORS options on the proxy

request_simcore_user_agent.title: Request Simcore User Agent
request_simcore_user_agent.description: used as label to filter out the metrics from the cAdvisor prometheus metrics

proxy_service_name.title: Proxy Service Name
proxy_service_name.description: service name given to the proxy

proxy_admin_api_port.title: Proxy Admin Api Port
proxy_admin_api_port.description: used as the admin endpoint API port

wallet_info.description: contains information about the wallet used to bill the running service

pricing_info.description: contains pricing information so we know what is the cost of running of the service

hardware_info.description: contains harware information so we know on which hardware to run the service

product_name.title: Product Name
product_name.description: Current product upon which this service is scheduledIf set to None, the current product is undefined. Mostly for backwards compatibility

product_api_base_url.title: Product Api Base Url
product_api_base_url.description: Base URL for the current product's API.

can_remove.title: Can Remove
can_remove.description: when True, marks the service as ready to be removed

can_save.title: Can Save
can_save.description: when True, saves the internal state and upload outputs of the service

was_removed.title: Was Removed
was_removed.description: Will be True when the removal finished. Used primarily to cancel retrying long running operations.

start_requested_at.title: Start Requested At
start_requested_at.description: moment in which the process of starting the service was requested

close_requested_at.title: Close Requested At
close_requested_at.description: moment in which the process of stopping the service was requested

Status2.title: Status2
Status2.description:
String representation of the container state. Can be one of "created",
"running", "paused", "restarting", "removing", "exited", or "dead".

download_link.title: Download Link
download_link.description: Presigned link for log file or None if still not available

service.title: Service
service.description: name of the docker-compose service in the docker-compose spec

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: after this interval the command will be timed-out

models_library__generated_models__docker.title: Status
models_library__generated_models__docker.description:
Status is one of `none`, `starting`, `healthy` or `unhealthy`

- "none"      Indicates there is no healthcheck
- "starting"  Starting indicates that the container is not yet ready
- "healthy"   Healthy indicates that the container is running correctly
- "unhealthy" Unhealthy indicates that the container has a problem

simcore_service_director_v2__models__dyn.title: Status
simcore_service_director_v2__models__dyn.description: Generated from data from docker container inspect API
